text: Ted Hughes OM, (17 August 1930 â€“ 28 October 1998) was an English poet and writer of children's stories. He was born in Mytholmroyd, West Riding of Yorkshire. He was married to the American poet Sylvia Plath from 1956 until her suicide in 1963. From 1984 until his death, he was the British Poet Laureate. He died of colorectal cancer in London, aged 68. He wrote a book called The Iron Man which inspired the movie The Iron Giant. ==Other websites== * Hughes at poets.org Category:1930 births Category:1998 deaths Category:British poets laureate Category:Cancer deaths in England Category:Deaths from colorectal cancer Category:English poets Category:Order of Merit Category:People from West Yorkshire Category:Writers from Yorkshire
title: Ted Hughes
